title: patch stuck on 32% help please!
body:
hey guys so i've just tried to update LoL & everytime i get to 32% it comes up saying "update failed" so i went "send reports" then it asked me to install "direct play" i think it was called, i did that & reopened the patcher & then the same thing still happened :/

has anyone had the same problem? or does anyone have any clue how to fix it?

thank you for reading :)

replies.body:
hey dude.. ive had it happen before... I completely  deleted all game remnants and re installed from scratch.  also un install pando media booster etc. Well that's atleast what I did.... 

Btw, would you mind giving me a view onm my 30 second prank video. lol, thanks brah

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dyh0mEWtTNY

This isn't humour.

It's not nice calling someone fat.

I've had the same thing happen to my friend, OP. He has done all of these things, so it is not guaranteed to work. It is even stuck at 32% for him, which is why I believe it has no real chance of working.
By the way, watch my elephant blowjob porn.
sorry to hear brah... Sure, post me a link to your porn and il watch it... I promise

Ok I have had this problem and this helped so.

1. Go Into my computer(im on windows) then go to Local Disk C.
2.  Go Into the LoL folder then find the RADS folder find the Projects folder.
3. delete lol_air-client 
4. restart your computer then go into lol launcher and the patch sould start running and work.

This will delete your custom builds that you have made

Let it sit on 32% or 33% or whatever it gets stuck at. The percentage isn't a very accurate representation on how the install is going, the % goes by files installed, not file size, so when it gets to a large file it gets stuck.

if 40+ minutes go by and it hasn't moved, then you should try other methods. But I can almost guarantee you that letting it go for a bit will fix it.

> [{quoted}](name=your hero batchy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=IJfkwNY1,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-01-18T11:29:10.234+0000)
>
> Let it sit on 32% or 33% or whatever it gets stuck at. The percentage isn't a very accurate representation on how the install is going, the % goes by files installed, not file size, so when it gets to a large file it gets stuck.
> 
> if 40+ minutes go by and it hasn't moved, then you should try other methods. But I can almost guarantee you that letting it go for a bit will fix it.

The problem is that it gets a failure message, and I assume that means the patch also stops downloading?
